newsitem.title: EU: Reuter EC Report Long-Term Diary for Nov 11 - Dec 31, 1997.
newsitem.headline: Reuter EC Report Long-Term Diary for Nov 11 - Dec 31, 1997.

text.p: LISBON - Organisation for Security and Cooperation in Europe (OSCE) holds annual summit (To December 3).
SINGAPORE - Inaugural World Trade Organisation (WTO) ministerial conference (December 9-13).
DUBLIN - Irish Presidency European Council of heads of state and government (December 13-14).
December 31, 1996 - Irish EU presidency ends. The Netherlands takes over to June 30, 1997.
EARLY 1997 - NATO holds summit to formally decide new members and approve a charter defining the alliance relationship with Russia - date to be set later.
AMSTERDAM - Dutch presidency hosts European Council of heads of state and government (June 16-17).
- Irish presidency hosts conference on "Local employment initiatives". Date and venue to be announced.
-- Preparation for December 13-14 Dublin European Council:
STRASBOURG - European Parliament plenary session (To November 15).
-- Proposal for an EP and Council decision adopting a programme of Community action on the prevention of drug dependence within the framework for action in the field of public health.
-- Proposal for a decision adopting a programme of Community action on health monitoring in the context of the action in the field of public health.
-- Proposal for a Council directive on the approximation of the laws, regulations and administrative provisions of the member states relating to the advertising of tobacco products.
-- Proposal for a decision of the European Parliament and of the Council creating a network for the epidemiological surveillance and control of communicable diseases in the European Community.
-- Setting-up of an EU-U.S. task force to develop and implement a global early warning system and response network for communicable diseases.
-- State of health in the EU.
-- Health protection requirements in Community policies.
-- Statement by presidency on Alzheimers Disease conference (November 21-22, 1996).
BRUSSELS (NEW ITEM) - ACP ministers hold council (To November 15). Venue: ACP house 451 avenue Georges Henri. Contact: ACP House (322) 743 0600.
BRUSSELS - Committee of the Regions holds plenary session (To November 14).

BRUSSELS - EuroCommerce launches the business of adding value, an analysis of European retail and distribution based on a study by London economics, and the EuroCommerce recommendations for future policy in recognition of the vital importance of this sector to the European economy (1030/0930 GMT) (To November 14). Venue: International Press Centre (IPC). Contact: Catherine Piana (322) 230 5 874.
BRUSSELS - Agra Europe holds third annual European grain conference (To November 14). Contact: Agra Europe (44) 1892 511 807.
TILBURG, Netherlands - Former German President Richard von Weizsaecker gives address on Culture of European Union (2000/1900 GMT). Venue: Brabant Catholic University.
ROME - U.N. Food and Agriculture Organisation holds world food summit (To November 17). European Commissioner Fischler meets U.S. Department of Agriculture Secretary Dan Glickman.
GENEVA - WTO holds conference with 48 poorest countries (To November 15).

PARIS - European Radiocommunications Office holds conference on "Regulation and legislation in a liberalised market" (1000/0900 GMT) (To November 15). Venue: Hilton Hotel. Contact: European Radiocommunications Office (45) 35 25 0300.
b) Sixth monitoring report on state aids in steel sector;
a) Proposal for a Council decision on a third multiannual
programme for small and medium sized enterprises (SMEs) in the European Union (1997-2000);
a) Commission's first report on the competitiveness of
b) A European policy for quality promotion;
- Review of regulation 4064/89 on the control of
- Communication from the Commission on the
competitiveness of subcontracting in the textile and clothing industry in the European Union.
STRASBOURG - European Commision and EP host "European film forum" (To November 20). Venue: EP. Contact: Daniele Blin, DCB Productions (33) 1 42 768 82 14.
BRUSSELS - Europe's 500 - the association for dynamic entrepreneurs hold international think-tank (To November 16). Venue: Conrad Hotel. Contact: Europe's 500 (322) 716 4838.

BRUSSELS - EuroCommerce holds conference on "The business of adding value - European retailing and distribution". Main discussions focus on commerce in the cashless society and the challenges of multimedia (second of two days). European Commission President Jacques Santer attends. Contact: Catherine Piana (322) 230 5874.

PARIS - Foreign ministers of countries involved in Bosnia discuss plans for two-year civilian peace consolidation programme in Bosnia; countries meeting include members of the contact group on former Yugoslavia of Western allies and Russia, and the Arab contact group.

LUXEMBOURG - The Edmond Israel Foundation and the Cedel Group hold "Vision for Europe" award ceremony (1800/1700 GMT). Participants include: Belgian Prime Minister Jean-Luc Dehaene and European Commission President Santer. Venue: European Centre, rue du Fort Thungen.
NEHGELO, The Netherlands - European Ostrich Association (EOA) holds world congress (To November 15). Venue: Expo Centre. Contact: EOA (31) 546 81 3677.
